lines.text: If you take away the horror of the scene, take away the tragedy of the death, take away all the moral and ethical implications that have been drilled into your head since grade one, do you know what you're left with? A 105-pound problem that needs to be moved from point A to point B.

That's not the point, Adam. I mean, the room is covered in blow; Moore looks like he went at it with a fuckin' mountain lion; I mean, the room looks like the Manson family stayed here a month. This is a major thin-ice situation we got here.
Now, let's just take a second here and take ahold of the situation and review our options.
We'll call the police!
Call the police. Good. That's one option.
That's not an option! This is not multiple choice, here!
Yes, it is. There are always options, Adam.

we clean up this mess, right now, bury it out in the desert, go home, and never look back - or, we can easily call the police, roll the dice, take our chances, and pray to God that it's only Michael who falls.
[Michael looks up, stricken]
desert - or police.
Calm down! We're not helping anything by losing our temper. Let's just get our heads together, okay? Whatever we associate in our nervous system determines our behavior. Just relax.

[seeing the mess in the room]
What the hell gets into you people?

[cheerfully]
Drugs and alcohol.

[grins]
Well, I got no problem with that.
Allow me to be the first to say that what we have done here is *not* a good thing. It's definitely not a good thing. But it was, given the circumstances, the smart play.
How do you know she's dead?
She's got no fuckin' pulse. She's got no pulse!
Where do you look? What side of the neck?
Left, left, left side.
Either side, you idiot!
Why are you calling an ambulance? She's dead.
We were playing. She bumped her head.
Bumped? BUMPED? She's got a fuckin' spike in her head!
[about the dead prostitute]
Nobody knows she's here. I called her personally. Nobody knows.
Her blood is all over the bathroom! Don't you think we got a little bit of a DNA problem here?
It's a marble floor. We can clean it up.

[after stabbing the hotel security guard]
Don't let him bleed on the carpet!
[They push the guard into the bathroom]
Get back - shut the door! Son of a bitch! He'll bleed out! He'll bleed out! He'll bleed out.
Adam, heads up.
[tosses Adam a head]

Time for some serious self-exploration - how do I function. For real! No more bullshit. Can I keep my cool when they bounce my bananas, when they won't play my song, etc, etc, etc. Do you get me? DO YOU GET ME?
Not really, no.
You know it's 500, right?
Yeah. Oh, yeah, no problem. Yeah, I mean... 500 of my dollars?
Right. Right.
But I thought... Boyd didn't pay?
No, Boyd didn't pay. It's 500.
Cool.
Straight sex, nothing kinky. Just...
No, no, no. I'm not gonna try to use you as a hand puppet or anything. I just wanna...
Okay.
...make sweet love to you because you have no idea what you've gotten into.
You fucking murderer!
You're a fucking loser! You're a loser!

[Forcibly walking Michael to his jeep]
We need to take a time out!
Go home! Go home, you fucking murderer!
Fuckin' loser!
GO HOME, YOU FUCKING MURDERER!
[Boyd has just murdered the hotel security guard who saw Tina's corpse]
I'm calling the police.
So help me God, you touch that fuckin' phone, I'll bury you with them!
[while trying to pray after burying Tina and the guard]
This is pathetic.
YOU'RE pathetic.
What did you say?

[Pointing at him]
You're not a team player.
Don't point at me.
You've never been a team player, that's why you don't have any friends.
What're you talking about? I have friends.
The hell you do.
The hell I don't.
You have acquaintances. Superficial golf-buddies.
[Pointing at him again]
You've never been a team player.
Don't point at me!
You have some serious male-on-male intimacy problems!
What're you fucking talking about?
You can't deal with men!
Guys, maybe now's not the time for this...

Dad used to bring home these sparklers for me and Adam, you know? (laughs) Sparklers! We'd go out back, the three of us - and we'd hold it up to the sky and watch the explosions of light and the sparks, you know, and Dad would be all "Wait for it! Here it comes! Watch for it! Here comes the wahoo!"
Wahoo?

Wahoo. The sparkler would burn hot, then hotter, then even hotter, and then there'd be this one moment of pure burn when that little fucker would cook perfect, just perfect. It would only last a second, but that second was *it*. And *that's* what Dad had us looking for, man.
The wahoo moment?
That's exactly right. Man - burning at his absolute. All the forces coming together - burning - just perfect, perfect harmony. That's what I'm driving at. Are you with me?
I think so.
I have been looking for that flash. I've been looking and I've been looking, and I can't find it. What if it already happened, you know? My moment! What if it already happened and I didn't see it?
You left a dead prostitute alone in the desert?
She's not alone...
I don't fucking know how to pray.
I am not to be common. I am a creature like no other.

[to Adam]
Your kid is one crutch short of a telethon, you've got a frigid, swamp-hog wife...

[Grabbing Michael]
You fucking...
I'm like a lighthouse! I stayed lit for you man! I never go dark.
[shouts]
Never go dark!
Look at 'em. I'm amazed the windows don't blow out of their fucking sockets with all the ass-puckering rage in these soulless lizards.
I just want her to be happy.

The same alarm clock every morning, same two pops on the same snooze button, same shower, towel, toothbrush, razor, blazer, hair pump, gel spray. It's a fucking epidemic, Fisher. You're getting married, baby. I'm not going to candy-coat it - it just gets worse. It's an eighteen-wheel cement truck that's going to crush every bone in your big body.

[referring to the hotel security guard that was murdered]
Do you think he had kids?
What?
Children. Do you think that man was a father?
I don't know.
I got a real bad feeling that he had children.
I think he was too young to have children.
We're gonna burn for this.
Are you calling me from jail?
Not yet...

[bride repeatedly slamming Boyd in the head]
This is *my* day!
[Michael has accidentally killed Tina the prostitute]
Michael... Michael... WHAT THE FUCK HAVE YOU DONE?
[Michael has accidentally killed Tina the prostitute]
You fucking guys. You fucking guys. You fucking guys! YOU FUCKING GUYS!
I killed my brother.
You never gave a damn about anyone but yourself.
Yeah, well you're a little fuckin' reject.
Yeah, well you eat my ass.
[Kicks Adam's minivan]
Hey!
Eat my fuckin' ass!
[Kicks his minivan again]
If you ever touch my minivan again, you're gonna be very sorry, brother! Very fucking sorry!
You are a LOSER!
I might just turn your little pathetic ass in! How about that, pal?
You think you're so fuckin' righteous? You were right there with us, side by fuckin' side!
Mr. Fucking Minivan!
The room is covered in blow; Moore looks like he went at it with a fuckin' mountain lion.
[while arguing about covering up Tina's murder]
I'm getting married, guys! I'm getting married!
I have got a wife and I've got two boys, OK? Don't tell me!

[Adam is in a hurry to get away from the petrol station because he thinks ordinary bystanders are eyeing him suspiciously about the murders in Las Vegas, but his wife has asked him to go inside the shop to buy some whizzers for their children. In his panic, he has difficulty finding them]
Fucking whizzers!
